title: Belief Systems Project
descriptions:
**Title:** The Belief Systems Project: Unveiling the Structure and Dynamics of Political Belief Systems

**Abstract:**

This grant proposal seeks funding for the Belief Systems Project, a comprehensive research initiative aimed at understanding the fundamental structure of belief systems and their impact on democratic politics, extremism, and political decision-making. Current conceptualizations of belief systems have been criticized for their flawed representation and loss of interrelationships between beliefs. This project introduces a novel approach, conceptualizing belief systems as systems of interconnecting attitudes and values, and employing network analyses to uncover their intricate structures.

Through a multi-method approach, including survey data, longitudinal panel studies, intensive longitudinal designs, experiments, and text analyses, this project will map the structure of systems of attitudes and values, answer questions about central concepts and clustering, model within-person belief systems and variations, and test changes in belief systems due to external and internal pressures. By examining the structure of political belief systems over time, between countries, and within individuals, this project will provide a deeper understanding of the complex dynamics driving democratic politics and extremism, ultimately contributing to the development of more effective policies and interventions.
